Objective

I am seeking a volunteer opportunity as a web developer or IT-related work.

Background

I would like to volunteer to gain real-life experience in programming and web development. One of my interests is creating relevant and user-friendly websites and web applications. Since summer 2015, I have been learning about web development and how to program in Javascript, AngularJS, jQuery, HTML/CSS, C, PHP, SQL, and Python. I can quickly learn and master new technologies and languages and work in both team and independent settings. Here is my first webpage, created with Bootstrap and AngularJS: http://plnkr.co/edit/OThirEp7f03Ai3pTa3fo?p=preview.

Laboratory Skills

Molecular cloning, site-directed mutagenesis, protein and DNA/RNA gel electrophoresis, fluorescent/chemiluminescent western blot, northern blot, DNA and RNA extraction, PCR, qRT-PCR, pull-down assays, immunoprecipitation, mass spectrometry, in vivo transcription assays, in vitro transcription/translation assays, stable and transient cell transfection, in vivo ubiquitination assays, RNA interference, ELISA, immunohistochemistry, fluorescence microscopy, DNA microarrays, transmission electron microscopy, bacterial protein expression and purification, and mouse work.

Work Experience

Clinical Research Division, Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, Seattle, WA
Postdoctoral Fellow, September 2012-present
My project is to identify the molecular target of our lead compound which have been shown to protect against aminoglycoside-induced auditory sensory hair cell death in animals.

Department of Molecular and Cell Biology, U.C. Berkeley
Graduate student researcher, April 2007-May 2012
Dissertation Title: "Function and regulation of the Super Elongation Complexes in HIV-1 transcription". I designed and carried out molecular and cell-based assays to uncover the biological roles of novel human transcription elongation factors in HIV-1 gene expression.

Department of Plant and Microbial Biology, U.C. Berkeley
Staff Research Associate I, Aug. 2004-Aug. 2006
The research focused on the unicellular green alga Chlamydomonas reinhardtii to study the functional roles of two biological gas channels, the Rhesus (Rh) and ammonium transport (Amt) proteins.

Allergan, Inc., Irvine, CA
Intern, June-Sept. 2003
The laboratory investigated immunological changes in dry eye disease and evaluated the effect of the immunosuppressor Cyclosporin A on these changes.

Department of Molecular and Cell Biology, U.C. Berkeley
Intern, June-Sept. 2002
The research interest was to study crystal structures of Mycobacterium tuberculosis transmembrane receptors and their biological functions.

Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, Berkeley, CA
Lab Assistant, June-Dec. 2001
The objective of research was to develop a technique that was able to perform multi-gene expression profiling of individual tumor cells.
